_header: Throughout a palace as I gan pass
Title(s): The Lamentacioun of the Duchess of Glossester
Subjects: Eleanor [Cobham], duchess of Gloucester; laments; historical poems; Fortune, wheel of
_description: ‘The Lamentacioun of the Duchess of Glossester’ (1447) — 13 eight-line stanzas including refrain: ‘All women may be ware by me’

OxfBal354.First Lines:
Thorow owt a pales as I can passeI hard a lady make a gret
                    mone…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…In prayer I will both walke & wakeAll women may be ware
                    by me
OxfBal354.Attributed Title:
Hic incipit (p. 360); Here endith þe lamyntacion / of the
                    Duches of Glowcetter (p. 362)
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).

CULHh412.First Lines:
Thorow owt a palys as I gan passeI herd a lady make gret
                    mone…
CULHh412.Last Lines:
…And in prayers wyll I wache and wakeAll women may be ware by
                    me
